alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lexington and west central Richland Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Batesburg-Leesville, moving northeast at 20 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Irmo, Batesburg-Leesville, St. Andrews, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, Oak Grove, Harbison State Forest, Riverbanks Zoo, Ballentine, Chapin, Gilbert, Summit, South Shore Marina, Oswald Park, Bundrick Island, Putnam`s Landing, and White Rock. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 40 and 67. Interstate 26 between mile markers 92 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
